alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 30 at 4:25PM CDT until May 30 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS COUNTY... At 425 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Evansville, or 17 miles west of Alexandria, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Douglas County, including the following locations... Millerville and Melby. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
